ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I definitely feel like my Spanish improved.

I learned better reading, listening comprehension, and speaking skills in Spanish. I also learned about indigenous activism, hispanic art, and social causes. I bettered my writing skills through the exams and essays.
Better reading, writing, speaking
Strengthening skills in Spanish
Analyzing works of art, films, and literature in Spanish. Daily practice speaking and/or presenting.

I learned so much about indigenous culture and art in this class! I think I was expecting to do more work on my grammar and speaking, but the cultural content ended up being extremely engaging! Through sheer practice and repetition, my speaking skills also improved.
This class was excellent in developing my ability to used Spanish in a conversational setting and expanding my understanding of human cultures and relationships to the world

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: One thing I really appreciated about this course was how intentionally it steered away from eurocentric perspectives. I thought that all the media we engaged with helped expand my understanding of social dynamics in Latin America with regards to indigeneity, race, class, gender and nationality. I appreciate how the class was structured to improve my Spanish skills through engagement with important topics, rather than through a focus on grammar and more technical aspects of language.

I think the discussion-based format was a major strength that forced us to practice and refine our verbal Spanish. But the lack of actual advanced grammar  lessons/review/assignments held me back from reaching fluency. Also, the greatest weakness of this course was the focus on social justice. It is definitely a language AND social justice course. To some people, it could be polarizing as the focus moved beyond language.

The course was very hands on and what we read and watched was very interesting. I wish the course did more work on listening comprehension, watching videos without subtitles and learning how to understand the language better.
I liked the engagement, but possibly more organization other than Jamboards
Speaking
Loved this class and I thought it was organized much better than the L2 and L3 Spanish classes. Weekly grammar reviews mightve been beneficial.

I think this course is very strong in providing engaging content and assignments. I wish we had more concrete opportunities to practice our speaking skills and expand our vocabulary, as I struggled with that throughout the semester.

Excellent course overall. Very strong in developing conversational skills. I would have appreciated, however, a bit more energy into in class discussion about how we can say different things in Spanish using phrases or grammatical constructs that we dont have in English

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, 100%, especially with Giseli! You will learn a lot about important issues like climate change, immigration, class, race and gender in Latin America.
Yes I would recommend this to another student because I feel like it is a good way to get a language credit that teaches you an important language.
Yes, it provides strong insight into Spanish culture and better writing/speaking
Yes
Yes
Yes, I would recommend this course to another student. It is always good to keep your language skills sharp, and with this course you learn a lot of content by doing so.
Absolutely, this was a wonderful class covering wonderful topics
